snippet: Kiner led the National League in home runs every year from 1946 to 1952, spent half a century broadcasting Mets games and was inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame in 1975.
abstract: Ralph Kiner, baseball's vastly undersung slugger whose achievements in the batter's box were obscured by his decades in the broadcast booth, dies at age 91; led National League in home runs every year from 1946 to 1952, spent half century broadcasting Mets games and was inducted into Baseball Hall of Fame in 1975.
lead_paragraph: Kiner led the National League in home runs every year from 1946 to 1952, spent half a century broadcasting Mets games and was inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame in 1975.

headline.main: Ralph Kiner, Slugger Who Became a Voice of the Mets, Dies at 91
headline.print_headline: Ralph Kiner, Hall of Fame Slugger and Longtime Mets Voice, Dies at 91
